titlestmt.author: Prepared by Ellen Kays, Anne Mitchell, Mary Mundy, and Maria Santiago

publicationstmt.publisher: Prints & Photographs Division, Library of Congress

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Prints & Photographs Division staff July 2004

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Location
repository.corpname: Prints & Photographs Division Library of Congress

did.abstract: Exit Art, an alternative gallery space in New York City, mounted the exhibition "Reactions: A Global Response to the 9/11 Attacks," in January 2002. Recognizing that many people had an urgent need to freely communicate their feelings, the staff sent out a worldwide appeal by letter and e-mail for individuals to send in creative responses. With one simple criterion, that each work be sized 8 1/2 x 11 inches, 2,443 pieces went on view at the gallery.

note.label: Note
note.p: For information about Prints and Photographs Division collections and services, see the Prints & Photographs Division's Reading Room Home Page.

The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically therein.

controlaccess.head: Organizations
controlaccess.corpname: Exit Art (Gallery : New York, N.Y.)--Exhibitions & displays.

userestrict.head: Restrictions
userestrict.p: Publication may be restricted. For information see "Exit Art" (http://lcweb.loc.gov/rr/print/res/rights.html)

altformavail.head: Additional form available
altformavail.p: Digital scans for ca. 50 items along with their associated descriptions are available through the Prints & Photographs Online Catalog, by searching using the call number (or title), "[input call number or title]"

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The "Reactions" exhibition was conveived and organized by Exit Art/The First World, Inc., New York City as a means to document the personal reactions of people world wide following the terrorist attacks of September 11th. Over 2,500 submissions were received and exhibited at Exit Art's gallery.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Pictures and manuscripts (collages, digital prints, drawings, paintings, photographs, poetry, letters, etc.) by professional artists, non-artists, and children reflecting personal responses to the terrorist attacks of September 11th, 2001.
